text.*:
The Pivotal Clash

Chapter Info

Volume:

102

Chapter:

1026

Japanese Title:

天王山

Romanized Title:

Tennōzan

Viz Title:

The Pivotal Clash

Pages:

17

Release Date:

September 27, 2021

WSJ Issue:

2021 Issue 43

Anime:

Episode 1050 (p. 2-11)
Episode 1051 (p. 11-17)
Chapter Chronology
← Previous Next →

Chapter 1026 is titled "The Pivotal Clash".

Contents

  • 1 Cover Page
  • 2 Short Summary
  • 3 Long Summary
  • 4 Quick References
    • 4.1 Chapter Notes
    • 4.2 Characters
  • 5 Author Comment
  • 6 Trivia
  • 7 Arc Navigation

Cover Page[]

Cover Page Request: "Nami and Leo" fashioning cute clothes for a lion cub" by PN Ebi.

The design of the shirts is the same as the shirt Bell-mère made Nami in Chapter 77.

Short Summary[]

As Luffy begins attacking Kaidou, he tells Momonosuke to use his dragon teeth to bite the Emperor; Momonosuke does so after grappling with his fear, causing the Emperor great pain. Luffy proceeds to loudly encourage Momonosuke and declare that the two of them will defeat Kaidou, and this is heard by the fighters on the Live Floor, giving the alliance great encouragement.

Kaidou and Momonosuke's flight through the air does result in the creation of storm clouds, which block the moon and force Inuarashi and Nekomamushi out of their Sulong forms, resulting in Jack and Perospero gaining the advantage in their respective fights. However, Luffy and Kaidou then engage in a clash that splits the heavens, resulting in the moon becoming visible again. The two mink rulers then reactivate their Sulong forms and unleash finishing blows against their opponents.

Long Summary[]

The Fire Festival continues in the Flower Capital as Tenguyama Hitetsu thinks back to when Tama told him she was leaving to go help the alliance on Onigashima, despite Hitetsu's protests. He hopes for her safety, totally unaware that Onigashima had reached the Flower Capital but was being hidden by thick clouds.

On the roof of the Skull Dome, a Mary reports that Yamato is on the roof and in the sky, he sees two dragons, one of them being Kaidou, the other being Momonosuke, though he doesn't recognize him as such. Also, Luffy was riding Momonosuke, who the Mary calls an enemy. Yamato thinks to when Momonosuke told him that he wanted to become a monster like Kaidou to help Luffy just as Kaidou launches Bolo Breath at the two, which Momonosuke is barely able to dodge. Luffy then tells Momonosuke something before jumping into the air and striking Kaidou with Gomu Gomu no Elephant Gun, knocking him into the ground. Momonosuke thinks about Luffy's request, which was for him to bite Kaidou, and after thinking about the horrible things Kaidou had done to him, he gets the courage to bite down on Kaidou's body, causing him to howl in pain. Momonosuke tightens his grip on Kaidou as he asks him what he is doing, but while afraid, Momonosuke doesn't back down. Luffy then comes in and strikes Kaidou with a Supreme King Haki-coated fist.

Meanwhile, in the Treasure Repository and outside the Skull Dome, Inuarashi and Nekomamushi have reverted back to normal, as the covered up clouds blocked out the moon. Luffy then calls Momonosuke, who was also heard by the samurai in the castle by the Mary, and points out that he just bit one of the Four Emperors. He asks if he is still afraid of anything after doing something so bold, and Momonosuke realizes he is no longer. Luffy then tells him to stop Onigashima in its tracks while he promises to beat Kaidou. The alliance and samurai react with happiness at the revelation that Momonosuke is still alive and cheer Luffy on, while Big Mom laughs at Luffy's claim and Kaidou still expresses disbelief at the idea of him still having a chance against him. Kaidou and Luffy then attack one another with their Supreme King Haki, not even touching one another and causing the skies and the heavens to split apart.

As a result, the moon returns, allowing Inuarashi and Nekomamushi to regain their Sulong forms, and with their Oden Ittoryu: Inu Spire and Oden Ittoryu: Neko Niko Ban, they finally defeat Jack and Charlotte Perospero, respectively. Also, Kurozumi Orochi, who is shown to still be alive, reacts with shock at Jack's defeat before remembering he is no longer Kaidou's ally.

Quick References[]

Chapter Notes[]

  • Unknown to the citizens at the Fire Festival, Onigashima is nearing the Flower Capital.
    • In a flashback between Hitetsu and Tama, it is revealed that Hitetsu was against her decision to travel to Onigashima.
  • A Mary on the roof of the Skull Dome reports about the fight.
    • Luffy and Momonosuke attack Kaidou.
      • Momonosuke bites Kaidou, causing him pain.
    • Kaidou returns to his Hybrid form.
    • Luffy tells Momonosuke to fly and stop Onigashima.
      • The message is broadcasted across Onigashima which causes the people inside to learn that Luffy is back in action and the mysterious new dragon is Momonosuke.
    • Luffy and Kaidou clash with Supreme King Haki, splitting the skies.
      • The Mary faints after the clash.
  • The fights of Inuarashi against Jack and Nekomamushi against Perospero are shown.
    • Both minks are badly wounded, and reverted back from their Sulong forms due to clouds covering the moon.
    • The clouds are moved after Luffy and Kaidou's clash of Haki, allowing the minks to return to their Sulong forms.
    • Inuarashi and Nekomamushi attack Jack and Perospero respectively, defeating them.
  • It is revealed that Orochi is still alive despite being decapitated the second time.
    • He watched the fight between Inuarashi and Jack.

Mokomo Dukedom

  • Nekomamushi
  • Wanda
  • Carrot

Author Comment[]


Author Comment
  • Translation
  • Original


Thank you so much for the support and kind words for my 100th volume! I'll keep working even harder!


100巻の様々なお祝い、ご協力、ありがとうございます！今後一層努力いたします!!

—Eiichiro Oda
English translation by VIZ Media. For comprehensive translation credits, see here.

Trivia[]

  • The cover feature another installment of the Sunflower-Lion running gag of series, which started in Chapter 77 during Nami's flashback, and continued with the Thousand Sunny's figure head in Chapter 436 and Chapter 439, and the cover of Chapter 568.

==Cover Page==
[[Cover Page]] Request: "[[Nami]] and [[Leo]]" fashioning cute clothes for a lion cub" by PN Ebi.

The design of the shirts is the same as the shirt [[Bell-mère]] made Nami in [[Chapter 77]].

==Short Summary==
As [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]] begins attacking [[Kaidou]], he tells [[Kouzuki Momonosuke|Momonosuke]] to use his dragon teeth to bite the Emperor; Momonosuke does so after grappling with his fear, causing the Emperor great pain. Luffy proceeds to loudly encourage Momonosuke and declare that the two of them will defeat Kaidou, and this is heard by the fighters on the Live Floor, giving the alliance great encouragement.

Kaidou and Momonosuke's flight through the air does result in the creation of storm clouds, which block the moon and force [[Inuarashi]] and [[Nekomamushi]] out of their [[Sulong]] forms, resulting in [[Jack]] and [[Charlotte Perospero|Perospero]] gaining the advantage in their respective fights. The two mink rulers then reactivate their Sulong forms and unleash finishing blows against their opponents.

==Long Summary==
The [[Fire Festival]] continues in the [[Flower Capital]] as [[Kouzuki Sukiyaki|Tenguyama Hitetsu]] thinks back to when [[Kurozumi Tama|Tama]] told him she was leaving to go help the alliance on [[Onigashima]], despite Hitetsu's protests. He hopes for her safety, totally unaware that Onigashima had reached the Flower Capital but was being hidden by thick clouds.

On the roof of the Skull Dome, a Mary reports that [[Yamato]] is on the roof and in the sky, he sees two dragons, one of them being [[Kaidou]], the other being [[Kouzuki Momonosuke|Momonosuke]], though he doesn't recognize him as such. Also, [[Monkey D. Luffy|Luffy]] was riding Momonosuke, who the Mary calls an enemy. Yamato thinks to when Momonosuke told him that he wanted to become a monster like Kaidou to help Luffy just as Kaidou launches '''Bolo Breath''' at the two, which Momonosuke is barely able to dodge. Luffy then tells Momonosuke something before jumping into the air and striking Kaidou with '''Gomu Gomu no Elephant Gun''', knocking him into the ground. Momonosuke thinks about Luffy's request, which was for him to bite Kaidou, and after thinking about the horrible things Kaidou had done to him, he gets the courage to bite down on Kaidou's body, causing him to howl in pain. Momonosuke tightens his grip on Kaidou as he asks him what he is doing, but while afraid, Momonosuke doesn't back down. Luffy then comes in and strikes Kaidou with a [[Haki/Supreme King Haki#Infusion|Supreme King Haki-coated]] fist. 

Meanwhile, in the Treasure Repository and outside the Skull Dome, [[Inuarashi]] and [[Nekomamushi]] have reverted back to normal, as the covered up clouds blocked out the moon. Kaidou and Luffy then attack one another with their Supreme King Haki, not even touching one another and causing the skies and the heavens to split apart.

As a result, the moon returns, allowing Inuarashi and Nekomamushi to regain their Sulong forms, and with their '''[[Oden Two Sword Style#Inuarashi|Oden Ittoryu: Inu Spire]]''' and '''[[Oden Two Sword Style#Nekomamushi|Oden Ittoryu: Neko Niko Ban]]''', they finally defeat [[Jack]] and [[Charlotte Perospero]], respectively.
